channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024120244
item.description:
Report E-2024120244

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 11:05 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal ULA. It was reported that approximately 12 ounces of Henry Pumadeq Flex 31MV released from one 5-gallon metal pale due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer #3214929. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Chemtrec has been notified Chemtrec Report #2024111800060, POC: Joanne. Waste label 222195-1 was created, 55-gallon poly drum, containing original container, shrink wrap and paper towels used during clean up.

item.title: Report I-2024110052
item.description:
Report I-2024110052

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T01:07:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: San Francisco
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 293807
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Near completion of boarding Flight 2045 a customefs HP Laptop went into thermal runaway in their backpack under the seat near the back of the aircraft. Flames were issuing from the bag as the lithium ion batteries flared. The cabin of the aircraft quickly filled with smoke. The customefs father removed backpack from underseat and successfully bypassed the Flight Attendant and her commands in the aft of the cabin and threw the backpack with flaming laptop out onto the rampat San Francisco(SFO) International airport through one of the aft aircraft emergency exit doorways. Customers were panicking to evacuate. Flight Attendants opened 3 emergency exits on the aircraft and some customers exited slides onto the ramp below while others egressed through the main cabin door back onto the jetway and into the terminal.
